question.title: Java formatter XML not found in multi-project workspace
question.body:
In VS Code I use a multi-project workspace with the following structure:

Root
+-- .devcontainer
+-- Conf
+-- Backend
+-- Frontend

In the Conf folder I have my XML file with the formatting rules I used with Eclipse. In the root I have a Root.code-workspace file and open VS Code using this file. The file contains the following (settings only shown for Java):

{
  "folders": [
    {
      "name": ".devcontainer",
      "path": ".devcontainer"
    },
    {
      "name": "Conf",
      "path": "Conf"
    },
    {
      "name": "Backend",
      "path": "Backend"
    },
    {
      "name": "Frontend",
      "path": "Frontend"
    }
  ],
  "settings": {
    // Java / Maven settings
    "java.compile.nullAnalysis.mode": "disabled",
    "java.autobuild.enabled": false,
    "java.configuration.updateBuildConfiguration": "automatic",
    "java.configuration.detectJdksAtStart": false,
    "java.project.explorer.showNonJavaResources": false,
    "java.format.settings.url": "Conf/java-formatter.xml",
    "[java]": {
      "editor.detectIndentation": false,
      "editor.insertSpaces": false
    },
    "maven.executable.preferMavenWrapper": false
  }
}

I'm using the Language Support for Java extension from RedHat (version 1.45.0) and when I run the task Java: Open Java Formatter Settings with Preview I get a popup stating that no formatter XML is available.

Also, when I let the extension generate a default formatter XML it still cannot find the file. Also, it will be generated inside the .devcontainer/.vscode folder and the workspace settings are updated to use this path.

So how can I update my formatter settings in a multi-project workspace?

[Update] Verified that for a single project folder the settings are found and can be updated.

[Update2] Seems to be an old issue.

question_comments.body: Tried already but doesn't work. As said in the second update it is a known bug
I would try "Conf/.vscode/java-formatter.xml" = multi-root no longer a problem, but still subfolder .vscode. Seeing the error message.
